issue: Original algorithm did not take advantage of improvements in the Riegl Lidar to handle short stature vegetation. CHM heights < 2 m were set to zero, instead of heights < 2/3 m.
resolution: Algorithm was updated to improve data product quality for short stature vegetation when the Riegl lidar was used for data collection.

issue: Files referenced in incorrect UTM zone (16N) for the Chequamegon-Nicolet National Forest region of STEI.
resolution: Files were reprocessed and referenced within the correct UTM zone (15N).

issue: Data was incorrectly referenced to UTM Zone 33N instead of Zone 13N
resolution: Data was reprocessed as part of RELEASE-2024 CHM reprocessing effort, and UTM zone reference was correctly set to 13N.

issue: Some 'No Data' values at site edges coded as NaNs instead of -9999.

The algorithm for determining the canopy height model (CHM) introduced artifacts which could be identified by viewing a histogram of canopy heights across the entire survey. Artifacts manifested as sharp reductions in canopy height at 5 m intervals.
resolution: Applied an updated implementation of the CHM algorithm which removed artifacts. See https://www.neonscience.org/impact/observatory-blog/aop-data-availability-notification-release-2024 for more details.

issue: AOP discrete lidar point cloud data were found to have abnormally high noise levels, which the standard noise filtering algorithms did not correctly classify. This mis-classification passed through to higher-level data products.  In most cases, a small portion of each site is affected by this issue, and the large majority of the site is still accurately classified.

Mis-alignment in the discrete lidar line to line adjustments. Some portions of the flight box were found to have up to ~meters vertical differences between flight lines, which affected all downstream lidar products.
resolution: Lidar lines were properly aligned using BayesMap StripAlign software and downstream L3 lidar raster products re-processed.

resolution: Lidar lines were properly aligned using BayesMap StripAlign software and downstream L3 lidar raster products re-processed.

issue: Missing lidar flight lines from one of the flight days.
